title: Basic Class Definition
code:
class Person:  # class name and definition
    def __init__(self, name):  # initializer, called during the object creation
        self.name = name  # assign parameter value to object variable

    def greet(self):  # a method which can be used on object
        return f'Hi, I am {self.name}'  # returned value when called

p = Person('Alice')  # creates Person object with name parameter 'Alice'
print(p.greet())  # Hi, I am Alice
explanation: Defines a class with an initializer and a method, creates an instance (object), and calls its method. A class can have as many attributes or methods as you need. Object-oriented programming helps organize complex programs.
